Title: Clinical Science and Perioperative Care
Definition: All bedside knowledge and actions directly involved in assessing patients, delivering anesthesia, managing airways, providing sedation, regional, postoperative care, and responding to emergencies.

Title: Foundational Sciences for Anesthesia Practice
Definition: The scientific foundation underpinning all clinical anesthesia practice, including human physiology and pathophysiology, pharmacology and pharmacokinetics, applied anatomy, and the chemistry and physics relevant to anesthesia delivery.

Title: Physiology of Organ Systems
Definition: Normal physiologic function of cardiovascular, respiratory, neurological, renal, hepatic, and endocrine systems as they relate to anesthesia delivery and patient response.

Title: Cardiovascular Physiology
Definition: Cardiac cycle mechanics, myocardial oxygen supply and demand, coronary circulation, cardiac output determinants, and vascular tone regulation.

Title: Respiratory Physiology
Definition: Ventilation mechanics, gas exchange, oxygen transport, carbon dioxide elimination, ventilation-perfusion relationships, and respiratory control mechanisms.

Title: Neurophysiology and Autonomic Function
Definition: Central nervous system function, cerebral blood flow regulation, intracranial pressure dynamics, autonomic nervous system balance, and neuromuscular transmission.

Title: Renal Physiology
Definition: Glomerular filtration, tubular function, fluid and electrolyte homeostasis, acid-base regulation, and drug elimination pathways.

Title: Hepatic Physiology
Definition: Hepatic blood flow, drug metabolism pathways, synthetic function, and bile production.

Title: Endocrine Physiology
Definition: Hypothalamic-pituitary axes, adrenal stress response, thyroid function, glucose regulation, and calcium homeostasis.

Title: Hematologic Physiology
Definition: Coagulation cascade, platelet function, fibrinolysis, oxygen-carrying capacity, and transfusion physiology.

Title: Pathophysiology and Coexisting Disease States
Definition: How acute and chronic disease processes alter normal physiology and impact anesthetic risk, drug handling, and perioperative management.

Title: Cardiovascular Disease Pathophysiology
Definition: Coronary artery disease, heart failure, valvular disease, arrhythmias, and hypertension as they alter anesthetic risk and management.

Title: Pulmonary Disease Pathophysiology
Definition: Obstructive and restrictive lung diseases, pulmonary hypertension, and sleep-disordered breathing affecting anesthetic management.

Title: Neurologic Disease Pathophysiology
Definition: Cerebrovascular disease, seizure disorders, neurodegenerative conditions, and neuromuscular diseases relevant to anesthesia.

Title: Renal Disease Pathophysiology
Definition: Acute kidney injury, chronic kidney disease, and electrolyte disorders affecting drug handling and fluid management.

Title: Hepatic Disease Pathophysiology
Definition: Cirrhosis, portal hypertension, hepatic encephalopathy, and coagulopathy of liver disease.

Title: Endocrine and Metabolic Disease Pathophysiology
Definition: Diabetes mellitus, thyroid disorders, adrenal insufficiency, and pheochromocytoma as they impact perioperative care.

Title: Hematologic Disorders Pathophysiology
Definition: Coagulopathies, anticoagulant effects, anemia, and hemoglobinopathies affecting surgical bleeding and oxygen delivery.

Title: Obesity and Nutritional Pathophysiology
Definition: Physiologic changes of obesity including respiratory mechanics, cardiovascular effects, and pharmacokinetic alterations.

Title: Pharmacology of Anesthetic Agents
Definition: Mechanisms of action, pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, and drug interactions for all agent classes used in anesthesia practice.

Title: Inhalational Anesthetic Pharmacology
Definition: Uptake, distribution, and elimination of volatile agents; MAC concepts; organ system effects of sevoflurane, desflurane, isoflurane, and nitrous oxide.

Title: Intravenous Anesthetic Pharmacology
Definition: Pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of propofol, etomidate, ketamine, and emerging agents like remimazolam.

Title: Opioid Pharmacology
Definition: Receptor pharmacology, pharmacokinetics of fentanyl, sufentanil, remifentanil, morphine, and hydromorphone.

Title: Neuromuscular Blocking Agent Pharmacology
Definition: Depolarizing and non-depolarizing agent mechanisms, onset and duration profiles, metabolism pathways, and factors affecting blockade.

Title: Local Anesthetic Pharmacology
Definition: Mechanism of nerve blockade, structure-activity relationships, pharmacokinetics, and systemic toxicity of amides and esters.

Title: Sedative and Anxiolytic Pharmacology
Definition: Benzodiazepine pharmacology, dexmedetomidine mechanisms and applications, and the sedation continuum.

Title: Cardiovascular Drug Pharmacology
Definition: Vasopressors, inotropes, vasodilators, antihypertensives, and antiarrhythmics used in anesthesia practice.

Title: Reversal Agents and Antagonist Pharmacology
Definition: Sugammadex, neostigmine, flumazenil, naloxone, and other antagonists.

Title: Applied Anatomy for Anesthesia Practice
Definition: Anatomical structures and spatial relationships essential for airway management, regional anesthesia techniques, vascular access, and understanding surgical positioning effects.

Title: Airway Anatomy
Definition: Upper and lower airway structures, anatomic predictors of difficult intubation, and variations affecting airway management.

Title: Neuraxial Anatomy
Definition: Vertebral column, spinal cord, meninges, epidural space, and cerebrospinal fluid compartments.

Title: Upper Extremity Peripheral Nerve Anatomy
Definition: Brachial plexus organization, individual nerve courses, and sonographic appearance.

Title: Lower Extremity and Trunk Peripheral Nerve Anatomy
Definition: Lumbar and sacral plexus anatomy, femoral, sciatic, and truncal nerve distributions.

Title: Vascular Access Anatomy
Definition: Arterial and venous anatomy for radial, femoral, and central venous catheterization.

Title: Thoracic and Mediastinal Anatomy
Definition: Heart, great vessels, lungs, and pleural spaces relevant to thoracic anesthesia and line placement.

Title: Chemistry and Physics Principles
Definition: Gas laws, fluid dynamics, electrical principles, solubility, diffusion, and physical chemistry underlying anesthesia machine function, drug delivery, and physiologic monitoring.

Title: Gas Laws and Behavior
Definition: Boyle's, Charles's, Dalton's, and Henry's laws as applied to anesthesia.

Title: Vaporizer Physics and Vapor Pressure
Definition: Saturated vapor pressure, vaporizer design principles, temperature compensation, and altitude effects.

Title: Fluid Dynamics and Flow Principles
Definition: Laminar and turbulent flow, Poiseuille's law, Bernoulli principle, and flow through orifices.

Title: Solubility Diffusion and Membrane Transport
Definition: Blood-gas solubility coefficients, Fick's law of diffusion, and membrane permeability.

Title: Electrical Principles and Safety
Definition: Ohm's law, capacitance, grounding, microshock and macroshock hazards, and electrical safety in the OR.

Title: Pressure Measurement and Transduction
Definition: Principles of pressure measurement, transducer function, natural frequency, damping, and zeroing.

Title: Clinical Equipment Monitoring and Technology
Definition: The clinical application, operation, and interpretation of anesthesia delivery systems, patient monitoring devices, airway equipment, and point-of-care technology at the bedside.

Title: Anesthesia Delivery Systems
Definition: Clinical operation, function checking, and troubleshooting of anesthesia machines, vaporizers, breathing circuits, and mechanical ventilators.

Title: Anesthesia Machine Components and Function
Definition: Gas supply systems, flowmeters, pressure regulators, fail-safe mechanisms, and integrated workstation components.

Title: Breathing Circuits and Gas Delivery
Definition: Circle system design, carbon dioxide absorption, Mapleson circuits, and fresh gas flow requirements.

Title: Vaporizer Operation and Clinical Use
Definition: Variable bypass and measured flow vaporizer operation, filling procedures, agent-specific considerations, and troubleshooting.

Title: Mechanical Ventilation Modes and Settings
Definition: Volume-controlled, pressure-controlled, and pressure-support ventilation modes available on anesthesia machines.

Title: Machine Checkout and Safety Systems
Definition: Pre-use checkout procedures, automated self-tests, leak testing, and verification of backup systems.

Title: Waste Gas Scavenging and Low-Flow Techniques
Definition: Scavenging system components, occupational exposure limits, and environmental considerations.

Title: Physiologic Monitoring and Waveform Interpretation
Definition: Standard ASA monitors including pulse oximetry, capnography, ECG, and non-invasive blood pressure, plus waveform analysis, artifact recognition, and alarm management.

Title: Pulse Oximetry Technology and Limitations
Definition: Principles of spectrophotometric oxygen saturation measurement, probe placement, motion artifact, and conditions affecting accuracy.

Title: Capnography and Waveform Analysis
Definition: End-tidal CO2 measurement principles, normal and abnormal capnogram morphology, and clinical interpretation.

Title: Electrocardiographic Monitoring
Definition: Lead placement, rhythm recognition, ST-segment monitoring, and artifact identification during anesthesia.

Title: Non-Invasive Blood Pressure Monitoring
Definition: Oscillometric measurement principles, cuff sizing, measurement intervals, and sources of error.

Title: Temperature Monitoring Methods
Definition: Core versus peripheral temperature measurement sites, probe types, and accuracy considerations.

Title: Depth of Anesthesia Monitoring
Definition: Processed EEG technologies including BIS, entropy, and patient state index.

Title: Alarm Management and Clinical Integration
Definition: Setting appropriate alarm limits, managing alarm fatigue, and prioritizing responses to multiple alarms.

Title: Advanced Hemodynamic and Neuromuscular Monitoring
Definition: Invasive pressure monitoring, cardiac output measurement, quantitative neuromuscular blockade assessment, and advanced physiologic parameters.

Title: Arterial Line Monitoring and Waveform Analysis
Definition: Arterial catheter placement indications, transducer setup, zeroing and leveling, and waveform interpretation.

Title: Central Venous Pressure Monitoring
Definition: Central venous catheter placement for pressure monitoring, waveform components, and clinical interpretation.

Title: Cardiac Output Monitoring Technologies
Definition: Thermodilution, pulse contour analysis, esophageal Doppler, and non-invasive cardiac output methods.

Title: Dynamic Fluid Responsiveness Parameters
Definition: Stroke volume variation, pulse pressure variation, and passive leg raise testing.

Title: Quantitative Neuromuscular Monitoring
Definition: Train-of-four monitoring, post-tetanic count, acceleromyography and electromyography devices.

Title: Transesophageal Echocardiography Basics
Definition: Basic TEE probe insertion, standard views, and fundamental assessments for the non-cardiologist.

Title: Airway Management Equipment
Definition: Direct and video laryngoscopes, supraglottic airways, endotracheal tubes, difficult airway adjuncts, and rescue devices.

Title: Direct Laryngoscopy Equipment
Definition: Macintosh and Miller blade designs, handle types, sizing considerations, and optimization techniques.

Title: Video Laryngoscopy Systems
Definition: Channeled versus non-channeled video laryngoscopes, device-specific techniques, and clinical selection.

Title: Supraglottic Airway Devices
Definition: LMA designs (classic, ProSeal, Supreme, i-gel), sizing, insertion techniques, and clinical applications.

Title: Endotracheal Tubes and Specialty Airways
Definition: Standard ETT design, cuff management, sizing for adults and children, and specialty tubes.

Title: Difficult Airway Adjuncts and Rescue Devices
Definition: Bougies, stylets, airway exchange catheters, and optical stylets.

Title: Flexible Bronchoscopy Equipment
Definition: Fiberoptic and video bronchoscope operation, setup, and maintenance.

Title: Point-of-Care Diagnostic Technology
Definition: Bedside ultrasound (POCUS), blood gas analyzers, coagulation testing, glucose monitoring, and rapid diagnostic devices.

Title: Point-of-Care Ultrasound Fundamentals
Definition: Basic ultrasound physics for clinical use, probe selection, image optimization, and machine operation.

Title: Arterial Blood Gas Analysis
Definition: Blood gas analyzer operation, sample handling, and result interpretation.

Title: Viscoelastic Coagulation Testing
Definition: TEG and ROTEM technology, test parameters, and result interpretation.

Title: Point-of-Care Hemoglobin and Glucose Monitoring
Definition: Non-invasive and minimally invasive hemoglobin measurement devices and glucose meters.

Title: Focused Cardiac and Pulmonary Ultrasound
Definition: Basic transthoracic cardiac views, lung ultrasound for pneumothorax and pulmonary edema, and IVC assessment.

Title: Perioperative Care and Anesthesia Techniques
Definition: The continuum of patient care from preoperative assessment through intraoperative management to postoperative recovery, encompassing all anesthesia delivery methods and modalities.

Title: Preoperative Assessment and Optimization
Definition: Comprehensive patient evaluation, risk stratification, NPO guidelines, premedication strategies, and perioperative optimization.

Title: Preanesthetic History and Physical Examination
Definition: Systematic approach to obtaining relevant medical, surgical, anesthetic, and social history.

Title: Perioperative Risk Stratification
Definition: ASA physical status classification, cardiac risk indices (RCRI, NSQIP), pulmonary risk assessment, and frailty screening.

Title: Preoperative Testing and Laboratory Evaluation
Definition: Evidence-based indications for ECG, chest radiography, laboratory studies, and specialized testing.

Title: NPO Guidelines and Aspiration Risk
Definition: Current fasting guidelines for solids, liquids, and specific populations.

Title: Premedication Strategies
Definition: Anxiolysis, aspiration prophylaxis, continuation or discontinuation of chronic medications, and prophylactic antibiotics.

Title: Perioperative Optimization and Prehabilitation
Definition: Optimizing chronic conditions before surgery including diabetes, hypertension, anemia, and nutritional status.

Title: Airway Management Techniques
Definition: Airway assessment, basic and advanced airway techniques, difficult airway algorithms, and extubation strategies.

Title: Airway Assessment and Difficult Airway Prediction
Definition: Systematic airway examination, predictive indices, and recognition of conditions associated with difficult mask ventilation or intubation.

Title: Basic Airway Maneuvers and Mask Ventilation
Definition: Head positioning, jaw thrust, chin lift, oral and nasal airway insertion, and two-handed mask ventilation techniques.

Title: Direct and Video Laryngoscopy Techniques
Definition: Positioning, blade insertion, laryngeal exposure optimization, and tube delivery for direct laryngoscopy.

Title: Supraglottic Airway Placement and Management
Definition: Insertion techniques for various supraglottic devices, confirming adequate placement, troubleshooting poor seal.

Title: Difficult Airway Algorithm Application
Definition: ASA Difficult Airway Algorithm implementation, decision-making at key branch points, transitioning between techniques.

Title: Awake Intubation Techniques
Definition: Patient selection, topicalization methods, sedation strategies, and flexible bronchoscopic intubation technique.

Title: Extubation Planning and Techniques
Definition: Assessing extubation readiness, high-risk extubation strategies, use of airway exchange catheters, and managing failed extubation.

Title: General Anesthesia Delivery
Definition: Induction techniques, maintenance strategies (inhalational, TIVA, balanced), depth of anesthesia management, and emergence.

Title: Intravenous Induction Techniques
Definition: Standard IV induction, dose modifications for patient factors, co-induction strategies, and managing hemodynamic responses.

Title: Inhalational Induction and Maintenance
Definition: Sevoflurane induction technique for adults and children, titrating volatile agents for maintenance, and understanding MAC-based dosing.

Title: Total Intravenous Anesthesia (TIVA)
Definition: Propofol and remifentanil-based TIVA, target-controlled infusion concepts, manual infusion schemes, and clinical indications.

Title: Rapid Sequence Induction and Intubation
Definition: Indications, preparation, preoxygenation optimization, drug selection, cricoid pressure application, and managing failed RSI.

Title: Emergence and Awakening Management
Definition: Timing anesthetic offset, preventing emergence delirium and agitation, smooth awakening techniques, and criteria for safe extubation.

Title: Anesthetic Planning and Case Management
Definition: Developing comprehensive anesthetic plans integrating patient factors, surgical requirements, and recovery goals.

Title: Regional Anesthesia and Acute Pain Management
Definition: Neuraxial techniques, peripheral nerve blocks, multimodal analgesia strategies, and ERAS protocol integration.

Title: Spinal Anesthesia Technique
Definition: Patient selection, positioning, landmark and ultrasound-guided needle placement, local anesthetic selection and dosing.

Title: Epidural Anesthesia and Analgesia
Definition: Epidural catheter placement technique, test dosing, local anesthetic and adjunct selection, managing patchy or failed blocks.

Title: Upper Extremity Peripheral Nerve Blocks
Definition: Ultrasound-guided interscalene, supraclavicular, infraclavicular, and axillary brachial plexus blocks.

Title: Lower Extremity Peripheral Nerve Blocks
Definition: Femoral, adductor canal, popliteal sciatic, and ankle blocks.

Title: Truncal and Fascial Plane Blocks
Definition: TAP blocks, quadratus lumborum blocks, erector spinae plane blocks, PECS blocks, and serratus anterior plane blocks.

Title: Continuous Catheter Techniques
Definition: Perineural catheter placement for prolonged analgesia, infusion management, patient-controlled regional analgesia.

Title: Multimodal Analgesia and Opioid-Sparing Strategies
Definition: Combining acetaminophen, NSAIDs, gabapentinoids, ketamine, dexmedetomidine, and regional techniques.

Title: Enhanced Recovery Protocol Integration
Definition: ERAS pathway components including preoperative education, carbohydrate loading, multimodal analgesia, goal-directed fluid therapy.

Title: Sedation and Monitored Anesthesia Care
Definition: MAC techniques, procedural sedation, the sedation continuum, and patient selection for non-general anesthesia approaches.

Title: Sedation Continuum and Depth Assessment
Definition: Minimal, moderate, and deep sedation definitions and clinical characteristics.

Title: Monitored Anesthesia Care Technique
Definition: MAC indications, drug selection, titration strategies, and supplemental oxygen delivery.

Title: Procedural Sedation for Specific Settings
Definition: Sedation techniques for endoscopy, interventional radiology, cardiac catheterization, and other NORA environments.

Title: Patient Selection for Non-General Anesthesia
Definition: Evaluating patient suitability for MAC or regional anesthesia, identifying contraindications.

Title: Managing Sedation Complications
Definition: Recognizing and managing oversedation, airway obstruction, hypoxemia, and paradoxical reactions during sedation.

Title: Intraoperative Physiologic Management
Definition: Hemodynamic optimization, ventilation strategies, fluid and blood product therapy, temperature management, and surgical positioning considerations.

Title: Hemodynamic Goals and Vasoactive Therapy
Definition: Target blood pressure and cardiac output goals, vasopressor and inotrope selection and dosing.

Title: Ventilation Strategies and Lung Protection
Definition: Intraoperative lung-protective ventilation including low tidal volumes, appropriate PEEP, and recruitment maneuvers.

Title: Fluid Management and Resuscitation
Definition: Crystalloid versus colloid selection, goal-directed fluid therapy using dynamic parameters.

Title: Blood Product Therapy and Massive Transfusion
Definition: Transfusion triggers, component therapy ratios, massive transfusion protocol activation and management.

Title: Temperature Management and Normothermia
Definition: Mechanisms of perioperative hypothermia, active and passive warming strategies, temperature monitoring sites.

Title: Surgical Positioning and Associated Risks
Definition: Physiologic effects of supine, lateral, prone, lithotomy, and Trendelenburg positions.

Title: Intraoperative Glycemic Control
Definition: Target glucose ranges, insulin infusion protocols, and managing diabetic and non-diabetic hyperglycemia.

Title: Postoperative Care and PACU Management
Definition: Emergence management, PONV prophylaxis and treatment, postoperative pain control, discharge criteria, and handoff communication.

Title: PACU Admission and Monitoring Standards
Definition: Transfer of care protocols, initial PACU assessment, monitoring requirements, and observation intervals.

Title: Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting Management
Definition: PONV risk stratification, multimodal prophylaxis regimens, and rescue antiemetic therapy.

Title: Postoperative Pain Assessment and Treatment
Definition: Pain assessment tools, IV opioid titration, regional technique management, and transition to oral analgesics.

Title: Discharge Criteria and Fast-Track Recovery
Definition: Modified Aldrete scores, phase I and phase II recovery criteria, same-day discharge requirements.

Title: Postoperative Handoff Communication
Definition: Structured handoff frameworks (I-PASS, SBAR), essential information elements.

Title: Recognition and Management of PACU Complications
Definition: Managing postoperative respiratory depression, emergence delirium, shivering, hypotension, bleeding, and arrhythmias.

Title: Patient Safety and Crisis Management
Definition: Emergency protocols, ACLS integration, malignant hyperthermia, local anesthetic systemic toxicity (LAST), anaphylaxis, and medication safety practices.

Title: Malignant Hyperthermia Recognition and Treatment
Definition: Early clinical signs, triggering agents, differential diagnosis, and MHAUS treatment protocol including dantrolene dosing.

Title: Local Anesthetic Systemic Toxicity (LAST) Protocol
Definition: Risk factors, prodromal symptoms, cardiovascular and CNS manifestations, and ASRA LAST treatment algorithm.

Title: Anaphylaxis Recognition and Management
Definition: Common perioperative triggers, clinical presentation across organ systems, and immediate treatment with epinephrine.

Title: Perioperative Cardiac Arrest and ACLS
Definition: Adapting ACLS algorithms to the OR environment, managing anesthesia-specific causes (4 Hs and 4 Ts).

Title: Medication Safety and Error Prevention
Definition: High-alert medications, look-alike/sound-alike drug pairs, syringe labeling standards.

Title: Airway Fire and OR Fire Response
Definition: Fire triangle in the surgical environment, prevention strategies during airway and laser surgery.

Title: Intraoperative Awareness Prevention and Management
Definition: Risk factors for awareness, monitoring strategies including processed EEG, and management when awareness is suspected.

Title: Crisis Resource Management and Team Communication
Definition: CRM principles including leadership, communication, situational awareness, and workload distribution.

Title: Specialty Anesthesia and Special Populations
Definition: Population-specific and procedure-specific anesthesia care requiring specialized knowledge beyond general principles.

Title: Pediatric Anesthesia
Definition: Anesthesia care for neonates, infants, children, and adolescents including developmental pharmacology, weight-based dosing, pediatric airway management.

Title: Neonatal Anesthesia Considerations
Definition: Physiologic immaturity of organ systems, thermoregulation challenges, glucose management, and pharmacokinetic differences in neonates.

Title: Infant and Toddler Anesthesia
Definition: Developmental changes affecting anesthetic management in the first years of life.

Title: Pediatric Airway Management
Definition: Anatomic differences of the pediatric airway, equipment sizing, uncuffed versus cuffed ETT selection.

Title: Weight-Based Pharmacology and Dosing
Definition: Developmental pharmacology affecting drug distribution, metabolism, and effect.

Title: Pediatric Fluid and Blood Management
Definition: Maintenance fluid calculations, allowable blood loss determination, and transfusion thresholds in children.

Title: Congenital Heart Disease Anesthesia
Definition: Anesthetic management of children with repaired and unrepaired congenital heart lesions.

Title: Pediatric Regional Anesthesia
Definition: Caudal epidural technique, peripheral nerve blocks in children, and local anesthetic dosing considerations.

Title: Emergence Delirium and Pediatric Pain Management
Definition: Risk factors, prevention, and treatment of emergence delirium.

Title: Obstetric Anesthesia
Definition: Labor analgesia, cesarean delivery anesthesia, high-risk obstetric management, and maternal-fetal physiologic considerations.

Title: Maternal Physiologic Changes of Pregnancy
Definition: Cardiovascular, respiratory, gastrointestinal, and hematologic adaptations of pregnancy.

Title: Labor Epidural Analgesia
Definition: Timing, technique, drug selection, and maintenance of labor epidural analgesia.

Title: Cesarean Delivery Anesthesia
Definition: Spinal, epidural, and combined spinal-epidural techniques for cesarean section.

Title: High-Risk Obstetric Anesthesia
Definition: Anesthetic management of preeclampsia, placenta accreta spectrum, cardiac disease in pregnancy, and morbid obesity.

Title: Obstetric Hemorrhage Management
Definition: Recognition and management of postpartum hemorrhage, uterotonic medications, massive transfusion in obstetrics.

Title: Fetal Considerations and Neonatal Resuscitation
Definition: Uteroplacental circulation, fetal heart rate interpretation, drug transfer across the placenta.

Title: Non-Obstetric Surgery During Pregnancy
Definition: Anesthetic considerations for pregnant patients undergoing non-obstetric surgery.

Title: Obstetric Emergencies and Crisis Management
Definition: Emergency cesarean delivery, maternal cardiac arrest, amniotic fluid embolism, and umbilical cord prolapse.

Title: Cardiac Vascular and Thoracic Anesthesia
Definition: Anesthesia for cardiac surgery, major vascular procedures, and thoracic surgery including one-lung ventilation and cardiopulmonary bypass.

Title: Cardiopulmonary Bypass Principles
Definition: CPB circuit components, anticoagulation management, myocardial protection, and physiologic effects of bypass.

Title: Anesthesia for Coronary Artery Surgery
Definition: Hemodynamic goals for CABG, managing myocardial ischemia, off-pump considerations.

Title: Valvular Heart Disease Anesthesia
Definition: Hemodynamic management for stenotic and regurgitant lesions of aortic, mitral, and tricuspid valves.

Title: Thoracic Surgery and One-Lung Ventilation
Definition: Double-lumen tube placement and confirmation, bronchial blocker alternatives, and physiologic management during one-lung ventilation.

Title: Aortic Surgery Anesthesia
Definition: Anesthetic management for ascending, arch, and descending thoracic aortic surgery.

Title: Peripheral Vascular Surgery Considerations
Definition: Anesthetic approach to carotid endarterectomy, abdominal aortic aneurysm repair, and lower extremity revascularization.

Title: Advanced Cardiac Monitoring and TEE
Definition: Intraoperative TEE for cardiac surgery, pulmonary artery catheter interpretation, and real-time hemodynamic assessment.

Title: Cardiac ERAS and Fast-Track Recovery
Definition: Enhanced recovery protocols for cardiac surgery including early extubation, multimodal analgesia, and goal-directed fluid therapy.

Title: Neuroanesthesia
Definition: Anesthesia for craniotomy, spine surgery, and neurointerventional procedures including cerebral physiology and intracranial pressure management.

Title: Cerebral Physiology and Neuroprotection
Definition: Cerebral blood flow regulation, autoregulation, intracranial pressure dynamics, and the effects of anesthetic agents on cerebral metabolism.

Title: Anesthesia for Craniotomy
Definition: Anesthetic management for supratentorial and infratentorial procedures, brain tumor resection, and intracranial aneurysm clipping.

Title: Spine Surgery Anesthesia
Definition: Anesthetic considerations for cervical, thoracic, and lumbar spine surgery.

Title: Neurointerventional Anesthesia
Definition: Anesthesia for endovascular coiling, thrombectomy, and other neurointerventional procedures.

Title: Neurophysiologic Monitoring Integration
Definition: Anesthetic effects on SSEPs, MEPs, and EEG.

Title: Awake Craniotomy and Functional Neurosurgery
Definition: Patient selection, sedation techniques, and managing the awake-asleep-awake approach.

Title: Geriatric Trauma and High-Acuity Patient Care
Definition: Anesthesia for elderly patients, trauma resuscitation, and management of critically ill or medically complex patients.

Title: Geriatric Physiologic Changes and Pharmacology
Definition: Age-related changes in cardiovascular, respiratory, renal, and hepatic function affecting anesthetic management.

Title: Perioperative Cognitive Dysfunction and Delirium
Definition: Risk factors for postoperative delirium and cognitive dysfunction, prevention strategies.

Title: Trauma Resuscitation and Damage Control Anesthesia
Definition: Anesthetic management of the trauma patient including permissive hypotension, massive transfusion, and damage control surgery principles.

Title: Burn Patient Anesthesia
Definition: Pathophysiology of burn injury, airway considerations, fluid resuscitation, and pharmacokinetic changes.

Title: Sepsis and Critical Illness Anesthesia
Definition: Anesthetic considerations for septic patients, hemodynamic optimization, and adrenal insufficiency.

Title: Organ Transplant Anesthesia
Definition: Anesthetic management for liver, kidney, and other solid organ transplantation.

Title: Bariatric Surgery Anesthesia
Definition: Physiologic changes of morbid obesity, airway management challenges, dosing considerations, and positioning.

Title: Ambulatory Surgery and Non-Operating Room Anesthesia
Definition: Anesthesia in ambulatory surgery centers, office-based settings, and NORA locations.

Title: Ambulatory Surgery Patient Selection and Optimization
Definition: Criteria for same-day surgery eligibility, medical optimization requirements, and social factors affecting safe discharge.

Title: Office-Based Anesthesia Safety
Definition: Equipment requirements, emergency preparedness, patient selection, and regulatory considerations for office-based anesthesia.

Title: Endoscopy Suite Anesthesia
Definition: Anesthetic considerations for upper and lower GI endoscopy, ERCP, and advanced endoscopic procedures.

Title: Interventional Radiology and Cardiac Catheterization
Definition: Anesthetic management in IR suites and cardiac catheterization labs.

Title: MRI and Radiation Therapy Anesthesia
Definition: MRI-compatible equipment, ferromagnetic safety, and remote monitoring challenges.

Title: Electroconvulsive Therapy and Procedural Anesthesia
Definition: Anesthetic management for ECT including seizure optimization and hemodynamic control.
